inn1.comm: starts over the wicket to the right-handed Roy, length ball, pushed quite wide and left alone
tighter to the stumps and shaping back a fraction at 88mph, Roy again watches it by
stuck on the crease and hit on the pads, probably beaten for pace there but the ball was a little high
pitched up and Roy leans into a drive, doesn't middle it and the ball rolls to cover
back of a length, this veers away as Roy thinks about chasing it... and then lets the umpire do his run-scoring for him
on the stumps, touch full and Roy dabs it towards midwicket from the crease
pitched up outside off stump, watches it under his nose and pushes into the covers, again finds the fielder
good pace to begin with, 89mph back of a length outside off, defended on the back foot
full length and swinging away, that's gone too far
swing and pace again, 92mph and Hales is late on it, scrapes the toe end of the bat and bobbles toward slip
pitched up and shaping away, again Pattinson can't quite control it
full outside off, Hales times a drive nicely coming forward but sends it zipping straight to the man at cover
down the leg side, Hales flicks and misses... touch of pad prevents it from being another wide
on the stumps, too straight and this doesn't swing, the bat comes down smoothly and pings four through midwicket, the ball racing away across the baize
touch full on off stump, shows it a straight bat in defence
bit of width and Roy sends his hands through a whippy punch square of the wicket, can't get it past point
goes straight and Roy chips the ball in the air between midwicket and mid-on, not quite timed but he'll get three into the deep
full and wide and toe-ended down to third man
length ball on middle and leg, closes the face and squirts one through backward square leg
short ball, climbing through outside off stump, Hales ignores it
length on off stump, 89mph and blocked solidly into the covers
on the pads, just a tickle around the corner from Roy, some work to do for fine leg and they get a couple
lovely timing, clipped of the pads and it goes scudding away through midwicket, using Pattinson's pace to simply deflect a boundary
shortish, dropped down into a gap at midwicket, Roy calls his partner through for a quick single
on the stumps, Pattinson is really getting it down quickly but Hales is unruffled glancing off his pads
full outside off stump, 91mph and driven firmly on the front foot, straight to mid-off
fullish, Roy again gets forward, doesn't quite time a drive into the covers
length on the stumps and tapped towards square leg shuffling across
slightly short, outside the line of off and this time Hales finds point playing square off the back foot
half an appeal from Starc, the ball thudding into the knee roll and ricocheting through gully, Hales was quite leg side and the ball probably pitched outside the line
Roy is looking in good touch again, just eases a length ball wide of mid-on, no great attempt to whack it but picks up three more
full outside off, Hales draws himself up and lashes along the carpet to mid-off
bumper from Starc, pushed across the bows and left alone
slightly full, Roy presses forwards and gets an inside edge through backward square leg
angled in with the arm, Hales waits and clips it through backward square
slightly short, sits up over middle and leg and Roy swivels to slap it down to deep backward square
pitched up outside off, drops the bat and punches towards point
back of a length, 90mph and Hales is beaten trying to pull, played over the bounce
full and straight and pushed back along the ground towards mid-on
authoritative pull from Roy, he stamps his mark on this delivery, sitting back and cracking the ball away in front of square
cute, deftly steered wide of the keepr for four more! Clever stuff from Roy, knowing that slip was no longer in, opened the face and used the pace of Starc to send the ball fine
three in a row! More gorgeous timing from Roy, whip[ping the ball away off his toes between midwicket and mid-on this time
slightly back of a length, hit on the thigh working across the line
he gets another one away, this time squirted wide of third man, again the pace takes it to the rope before the fielder can get across
Starc now loses his radar down the leg side

full on middle and leg, Roy connects with another good-looking on drive but Starc's fingertips ensure the ball finds its way to mid-on rather than running straight down the ground for another boundary
pitched up and Hales nearly overbalances chopping the ball towards mid-on
pitched up and punched back to mid-off
full length outside the line of off again, Hales sends a drive along the ground to mid-off again
short outside off, maybe rolling his fingers over it, swings across the line and misses
quick and straight and dug out into the off side
Pattinson joins the dots, the ball homing back in on off stump, Hales chops down on it - maiden over
drags this a little short and Roy's in such good touch that he only has to pick a gap square on the off side and that ball runs away for four
tosses this up a bit more, worked into the leg side
looped up around off stump, Hales leans out and punches one down the ground to long-off - 50 opening stand comes up
on the stumps, waits and whips another single away through midwicket
holds this up a little, there's some turn and the ball hits the outside half of the bat and rolls square
on the stumps, fractionally short and worked into a gap out towards deep midwicket
slightly back of a length outside off, defended down into the ground
fuller, in the slot to drive, Hales fails to middle his shot again, stopped at cover

full and clipped off the pads... straight to short midwicket! Hales has been thrashing around but getting nowhere for a while and he's finally picked out a fielder, wasn't over the shot and the catch was snapped up at waist height. Hales swipes his bat in frustration before sloping off
working up good pace outside off, above 90mph and defended on the back foot
back of a length, slightly wide and Taylor guides one down to third man to get off the mark
shot! Roy continues to look imperious, oozing forward and drilling a cover drive to the fence
tossed up outside off, Taylor scuttles forward but can't get it past cover
flighted, Taylor waits and opens the face a little more, pushed in front of square
tries to uses the feet, darted in on off and Roy squeezes the bat down on it
well bowled, gives this some air and it drifts in before spinning away past the bat, Wade then takes off the bails for good measure but Roy hadn't moved out of his ground
length, flatter trajectory, worked away through square off the back foot
tossed up and Roy again closes the face, nudges through midwicket for one
back of a length outside off, 88mph, Roy gets over it in defence
edged for four! Did Roy open the face at the last moment? Possibly, and with no slip in it flew away, wide of the diving Wade
goes back and across and this time steers the ball deliberately wide of third man, comes racing back for two - wave of the bat for an attractive fifty from just 34 balls
length outside off, Roy runs another one down to third man
short outside off, drops back and defends square
banged in short again, 88mph and Taylor jumps back, fends it away through backward square
tossed up, Taylor skips out and punches down the ground to long-off
flighted, around off stump, pushed back past the bowler
length ball, slightly flat and worked away through square leg off the back foot
looped up, Roy comes forward and punches to the bowler's left, Agar gets a hand on it but can only take the pace off, mid-off cleans up but they get through for a single
angled in with the arm, pushed down the ground coming forwards
pushed through a bit quicker outside off, Roy steers it away through cover point
pitched up on the stumps, Roy sashays forward and whips through mid-on, looks like another boundary but for an excellent bit of fielding, still they get back for two
full, 92mph outside off, pushed watchfully into the covers
phwoar, that's four! Short outside off, Roy rocks back and uses the pace, swats it aerially over backward point and away to the fence
on the stumps, worked into the leg side
good pace from Cummins, bringing the heat, Taylor meets it with an icy defence
pitched up around the line of off, shows it a straight bat coming forwards
tossed up, there's some grip and the ball clips the outside edge as Roy pushes forwards, falls safely into the off side and bounces away into a gap
angled in, again the ball straightens, gets a leading edge into the covers
full length, Taylor dances out and whips the ball away through midwicket, gets a couple into the deep
Agar has a graze on his elbow already but he throws himself after another punch down the ground, can't quite get there
pushed down the leg side, Roy is hit on the pad play across the line

comes forward, chipped into the off side without conviction - and Roy is gone! This is a waste, he was looking so good and he has donated Agar his maiden ODI wicket, popping the ball straight to short extra cover. Maxwell initially palmed it up into the air and then grabbed it at the second attempt
slightly back of a length and veering down the leg side
over the top of off, 91mph and jabbed back into the covers as Taylor skitters across his stumps
even quicker from Cummins, 92mph on off stump, Taylor shows a slightly wonky bat and gets a thick inside edge through backward square leg
pushed across the lefty from over the wicket, flying through off a length and left alone - that's left a smoke trail at 96mph!
touch full and wide and stroked through the covers, that's a nice way to get going, leaning out and punching a half-volley to the boundary boards
there's the throat ball in response, nasty from Cummins, the batsman just manages to jerk out of the way
searing pace and a horrible length, rising past the outside edge as Morgan stays back and fends at it... There's a somewhat belated appeal but don't think any bat was involved
tossed up on middle and leg, worked away into a gap at midwicket
stays round the wicket, tossed up on leg stump, defended
gives it some air, leg-stump line, Morgan leans out and taps back to the bowler
slightly short from Agar, the batsman drops back and flicks the ball, momentarily in the air but short of midwicket
full and flighted outside off, reaches for the drive but picks out cover
very full on the stumps, moves to the off side and dabs one through backward square leg
short of a length at off stump, 92mph, Morgan just puts bat to ball with an open face and guides through point
that's quick again, 92mph, and it's a bouncer angled across which Morgan attempts to hook but is beaten for pace over the top edge
this time it's shorter but wider outside off, Morgan isn't entirely in control but manages to deflect it towards third man
short of a length at off stump, 93mph, Taylor hops across the crease and defends
pulled through midwicket from outside off, Taylor got over the top of the ball
he's not comfortable against this one, 91mph, short, but not overly short, and at the body...Morgan thrusts his gloves in front of his face and turns his head, taking the ball straight on the hands
uses his feet then clips a low full toss through midwicket...takings England a hundred
round the wicket, flicked from full outside off down the ground
nicely bowled, flighted on middle and off, gripped and took a thick outside edge as Taylor played forward
defended from middle and leg
more turn, a fraction shorter, Taylor works it behind square on the leg side
full at the stumps, driven through the covers to the sweeper
nearly does him first ball, Taylor using feet and almost yorks himself as the ball is fired full outside off but manages to get a toe end to third man
round the wicket, tucked wide of mid-on
driven towards mid-off who is inside the circle...sharp run, but both batsmen scamper well
just wide of mid-on! Morgan lofting the drive this time, connected reasonably cleanly but didn't get the elevation he needed but it's just straight of mid-on as he pulls out a dive
defended to the leg side
pushed square into the off side
missed stumping, nice piece of bowling, beats Morgan on the inside edge as aims to the leg side and Wade can't glove the ball at all. Morgan defeated by length as much as spin
driven down to long-off
gently worked from outside off down the ground
worked off the stumps square into the leg side
just a hint of width outside off, cut into the point region
clipped towards mid-on and more scurrying from Taylor
stays round the wicket, flicked to square leg
neat footwork, gets to the pitch then clips it through midwicket
taken from off stump to the leg side
down the pitch again and whipped through the leg side
brings out the reverse sweep, makes good connection, the ball goes in the air but away from short third man and races to deep point
full outside off, driven to cover
grips and turns, squares up Taylor as it beats the outside edge and takes him high on pad. Lovely bowling
fraction shorter outside off, driven from the back foot to deep cover
backs away to leg, exposes his stumps, Agar drags the length back but Morgan is able to cut to deep cover...nice contest
pulled down a little short and swung to deep square
bunted back down the pitch
defeats him again, this time with a full ball outside with Morgan aims a booming drive at...the ball grips and turns enough to beat the inside edge. Wade doesn't take it. Not a chance this time
pitches outside leg, flicked in the air in front of square and Taylor is rapid between the wickets
goes back and defends to the on side
pushed across outside off and played to the covers
closes the face to work into the leg side
pushed down the ground
goes for a lap-sweep, loops off a top edge over Wade's head into space
floated up at the stumps, tapped into the on side and mid-on can't get in quickly enough
appeal for lbw! Morgan back in his crease, but Rob Bailey says not out. Turned too much, perhaps. And the bounce
slips this one down the leg side
lovely timing and placement by Morgan, strong wrists as he lofts his over extra cover and between the deep fielders on the off side
touch shorter, pushed back to the bowler
worked from outside off down to long-on
pushed square into the off side
flicked to square leg
a little shorter, on the pads, tucked in front of square
nudged to the leg side
cut from outside off to cover
played out to deep cover
gets a loopy leading edge into the leg side but it plops into space towards long-on
full outside off, and that's a strong cover drive by Taylor as he moves forward nicely into the ball...deep cover is just able to get around
chopped down to third man from outside off
short of a length outside off, dropped into the backward point area. Maxwell's throw hits Morgan. The crowd boos. Maxwell smiles and apologises
tucked through the leg side
wrong line, too much on leg stump, Morgan flicks his wrists and sends it very fine
adjust the line, back outside off, Morgan angles it down to third man
more top-class placement from Morgan, it's a full delivery, he just opens his stance a fraction then drives sweetly through extra cover and places it wide of the sweeper
speared down the leg side, Morgan misses his sweep
a little shorter and slower, Morgan onto the back foot and it slides off the face to backward point
flicked down the ground to long-on
lofts straight down the ground, bisects long-off and long-on
flicked to midwicket
appeal for lbw as Taylor comes down the pitch, takes him on the front pad with significant turn...long way down the pitch
back of a length, straight, pushed to mid-on
uses his feet then drives crisply straight at mid-off, still able to steal the single
full outside off, Taylor throws his hands through a drive which skews down to third man
short, angled across the left hander, pulled in the air just in front of square
that's his first boundary...drives another full delivery and gets it square through point this time, has the timing and placement to beat the cover sweeper
tighter to off stump, back of a length, defended
just wide of Wade! Morgan edges a powerful drive, and the nick evades the out-stretched left glove of the keeper as he flung himself in the air
another edge down to third man, this one off the bottom of the bat against a low full toss...takes him to his fifty off 46 balls
short and down the leg side
back full outside off, punched to cover
his bottom hand comes off the bat as he walks forward into this drive...not quite to the pitch
outside leg stump, neatly flicked away fine but deep square is able to get around the boundary
full outside off, 79mph, driven wide of cover
guided down to third man and now it's Taylor to fifty, a controlled innings off 59 balls
fantastic strike by Morgan, picks up a full delivery, a slower ball, and dispatches it perfect straight down the ground. The best of Morgan
another one with pace off, outside off this time and cut down to third man
full outside off, 71mph, driven to cover
a mighty powerful pull from Taylor, fetches a short(ish) delivery from outside off and hammers it through midwicket
fuller and straight, defended
full and wide, Morgan drives square through point
driven powerfully to mid-off
low full toss outside off, driven to deep cover
full outside off, again driven to deep cover
full and angled into the pads, deflects towards fine leg and Wade does the chasing
quickly onto another short ball, gets over the top of it - perhaps not the hardest thing for Taylor - and pulls through square to take England to 200
width outside off, cut firmly but straight to Maxwell at point
cuts again, takes more of a bottom edge this time and bobbles to Maxwell's right this time
pushes a length ball with an open face...Maxwell the man again
short, pulled backward of square
full at leg stump, takes the pad to the leg side
full outside off, driven down the ground

picks out long-off...Maxwell strikes first ball back! Aims to clear the boundary again, but it comes off the bottom of the bat and lands comfortably in the lap of Starc as he takes a couple of paces in
on the stumps, comes forward and clips one down the ground

round the wicket, tossed up and Stokes attempts to reverse sweep his first ball, hit on the pad and Maxwell appeals... After some thought, Joel Wilson shakes his head. Actually, replays show the ball struck him on the gloves
worked back past the bowler this time
angled in on the stumps and Taylor nudges one more away through midwicket
tossed up outside off, Stokes comes forward and opens the face to punch through point
length ball on the stumps, defended
slightly short, over the stumps and Stokes again blocks on the back foot
beaten outside off, teasing him with a tight line and length, Stokes drawn into pushing at it
this drifts down the leg side, flick and a miss, must have kissed the padding as not called wide
presses forward to a length ball, drops it into the covers to the right of the fielder and calls through Taylor, who makes his ground as the throw comes in
good length outside off, Taylor drops back and runs it down to third man
round the wicket, tossed up on the stumps, clipped to backward square leg
gives this a bit more air, Taylor is down on one knee to sweep, picks a gap for a couple
on the stumps, worked to short midwicket
angled in again, Taylor closes the face and picks out the same fielder
pushed through on middle and leg, Taylor gets a leading edge short on the off side trying to work across the line
tossed up, comes forward and punches one down the ground
pitched up on middle stump, dug out towards mid-on
takes the pace off, Taylor defends it back towards the bowler
another slower ball, wide of the stumps and Taylor throws his hands at a cut and misses
tighter to the off stump, pushed back to the bowler coming forwards
length outside off, cutter from Marsh, opens the face and runs the ball down to third man
length delivery on the pads, Stokes glances through midwicket for one
darted in on the pads, Stokes aims an agricultural slog to leg and is struck on the pads
presses forward and defends into the off side
gives this some air, Stokes comes out but doesn't quite get to the pitch and elects to defend
steps out and crunches hard into the ground, gets one through the covers
tossed up on middle stump, drilled back along the ground but straight to the bowler
gets forward and this time manages to lift the ball over mid-off, nicely struck from inside to out, clears the fielder and that's a welcome boundary
another slower delivery from Marsh, outside the line of off, play and a miss from Stokes
gets across and bunts a length ball into the covers
sprays it wide as Stokes jumps out... Too wide
full and wide and this time Stokes chases it, slicing over backward point, third man has to get round to cut it off
short ball and BLAP! that will be four... Stokes hits his mark at last, his feet in the air as he swings the ball meatily away through midwicket
gets forward and pushes one into a gap in the covers
full and speared on leg stump, hits the pad and Taylor is sent back after advancing a few steps down the pitch
tossed up and Stokes swipes a couple in front of deep extra cover

slogged high into the leg side and Finch positions himself safely under it at mid-on! Stokes will obstruct the England innings no longer, he was trying to put Maxwell into the confectionary stall but only succeeded in sending a top edge billowing straight up into sky
angled in and straightening a touch as Taylor plays it from the crease
goes down early on to one knee and paddles the ball away over short fine leg for a couple
flighted outside leg stump, again Taylor is waiting for it, crouched low and flicking the ball very fine, Bairstow runs hard for a third
length ball, nice and slow on leg stump, Bairstow prods at it and misses
short of a length, Taylor shuffles across and nudges a single through backward square
good length outside off stump, Taylor drops back, angles the bat and runs one to third man
pitched up and driven into the covers, there's a direct hit at the non-striker's end but Taylor hadn't gone anywhere
short and sitting up over middle and leg, YJB swats a pull through square leg to get off the mark
Taylor chides himself for swishing at a wide one and missing, might have been a slower ball
length, 91mph outside off, dabbed towards Maxwell at point, who is quickly into position to throw, should they want to take him on. They don't
length on the stumps, YJB advances and gets a leading edge into the covers
darted on the stumps, turned to midwicket
tossed up, reverses the hands and swats one through backward point
floated up on the stumps, Taylor wheedles down the pitch and pushes one to long-on
full length, Bairstow drives powerfully but sends it straight and quickly to long-off
pushed across outside off, steered through point into the deep
full outside off, 89mph, Taylor connects with the toe-end of the bat
takes a couple of early steps down the pitch, swings hard across the line... and misses
moves outside off and again tries to club to the leg side, it's a length delivery, not really there for the shot and again he fails to connect
pulls across the line, this hits the thigh pad and runs wide of Wade for one
length ball outside off, Bairstow flashes at it, gets a bottom edge into the turf through to Wade
good length outside off, YJB backs away, swings like a rusty gate and misses - just one off the over, England threatening to go into reverse
round the wicket, full toss outside off and Taylor does manage to clear the infield, not out of the middle and deep extra cover cuts it off
a boundary, only England's third since the 31st over, Starc losing his line down the leg side and Taylor helps it on its way
full outside off, pushed through the covers coming forwards
attempted yorker but it's not quite full enough and Bairstow crashes it away over extra cover, just clears the man and that'll be four more
over over the wicket, fired in full, Bairstow squeezes it down the ground through mid-off
sprayed wide down the leg side... Starc not at his best here
slower ball, wide of the stumps and Taylor spots it, squirts through backward point for a couple
back of a length outside off, Bairstow bottom-hands it over midwicket for one into the deep
shortish, 90mph, turned short into the leg side for a scampered single, Taylor goes into the 90s
back of a length, wide of the stumps, YJB mistimes a cut to backward point on the bounce
full bunger, right up in the blockhole and Bairstow does well to dig one out towards long-on
bit of width, Taylor moves across and steers one through the covers
Bairstow moves across early, tries to play a ramp shot and ends up toeing the ball into the off side - another excellent over from Cummins
round the wicket, short and hoicked over deep midwicket, England pick up only yheir second six of the innings... No arguing with that from Bairstow, a hefty clump into the stands
goes back over the wicket, steered to backward point

full, driven along the carpet to Smith at mid-off, Bairstow takes on the throw... and a direct hit does for him! It was very tight and YJB went scampering back for a second from the ricochet but the umpires sent it upstairs and replays proved he was a few milimetres short
full outside off, Taylor throws the bat, gets a thick inside edge to Wade's left and Moeen pinches the strike
full length outside off, tries to drive and gets a thick edge to square leg
slapped through the covers, Moeen getting forward to an 89mph delivery outside off
Moeen goes big... and goes home! Tries to pull a length ball from outside off stump and sends a top edge steepling to midwicket. England are trying to tap out, here
slides on to the pads, Taylor glances fine and it runs away, using Cummins' pace and that boundary takes him to within a well-timed blow of a hundred
full and wide, Taylor squeezes a drive towards backward point, they take on Maxwell and Plunkett gets home
back of a length outside off, Plunkett plays a back-foot drive into the covers for one
short and pulled to midwicket, Plunkett had come charging down... and he's run out by a mile as Taylor sends him back! Another flaccid dismissal, although to be fair to Taylor there was no run there
short delivery on off stump, 90mph from Cummins, waits and pulls through backward square to go to 98 and keep the strike
slides this down the leg side
pushed across the right-hander from over the wicket, steered through gully, Taylor on to 99 now and past the 98 not out he made against Australia at the World Cup
back of a length, worked off the hips through backward point for a couple
goes round the wicket, pitched up outside off, Woakes can't get a drive through the infield
low full toss from Starc, 89mph and bunted through cover point for a single
back over the wicket to Taylor, he comes forward and punches a half-volley to extra cover... Still he waits
full length, wide of the stumps and Taylor thrashes a single through the covers to reach his century is kept on 99 by a brilliant diving stop from Smith
Woakes slogs into the air, out towards long-on... but it falls short of the man running in

full and driven back down the track it hits Woakes' bat and rebounds into the stumps... Taylor is racing down the pitch regardless and he dives for his ground as Cumming tries to take a stump out of the ground! The umpires decide not to send it upstairs so that's it - a maiden ODI hundred for James Taylor. Well played, though England's total is still looking a bit limp
back of a length outside off, Woakes swings at it and misses
appeal for lbw from Cummins, hit over the knee roll playing back in front of the stumps
comes forward and steers this through the covers
full outside off, Woakes drives powerfully but Cummins gets some boot in the way and deflects it to mid-off - just a single to end a very good spell at the death
full outside off, steered through backward point by Woakes
short of a length, tries to club down the ground... but can't clear mid-off! Taylor falls for 101, top-edging tamely to the edge of the ring to leave England eight down
clears the front leg and deposits the ball into the stands at deep midwicket! Woakes gives it some last desperate humpty and puts England on the brink of 300
round the wicket, fried in full and dug out down the ground for one
short, outside off, Rashid pulls in the air but just short of mid-on, they run regardless
pitched up, Woakes backs away and drills the ball back along the ground, Starc gets a hand on it but can't prevent the single that sees England finish on a round 300

inn2.comm: short of a length outside off, defended square of the wicket towards point where Stokes lets it through his hands then leaves it for someone else to collect by which time Burns is off the mark
and he's away first ball, pushes a fuller delivery into the off side
short of a length, angled into Burns, worked towards mid-on
fuller this time, Burns pushes back towards Finn who sticks out his right hand
angled into the pads, clipped sweetly to mid-on
tight line around off stump, 88mph, defended off the back foot to the covers
short of a length outside off, Finch tries to force it off the back foot but doesn't get any timing
keeps it on the shorter side, angling into Finch who tries to pull it off his hip but doesn't make contact
gets inside the line of this delivery and flicks it backward of square...ah, there's no bat. Just off the thigh pad
punched sweetly from off stump towards mid-on
a little fuller this time, Burns onto the front foot and just blocks...the ball beats Woakes and neither mid-on or mid-off can stop it. Single given away
aims to pull this but the ball takes his the top of his front leg and bobbles towards slip
full, angled into the pads, flicked wide of mid-on
short of a length, worked into midwicket
buzzers! On a length outside off, pushed into the off side and more free runs handed to Australia as Taylor's throw from cover is fairly wide of the stumps and poorly backed up by Moeen
gets on top of the bounce outside off, plays it square towards point where a ball goes cleanly to hand
full and straight, 88mph, driven to cover
nearly dragged on! Aiming to force a ball outside off into the covers, takes a bottom edge and just bounces over the stumps
back of a length at middle and off, 86mph, defended towards mid-on
a short ball outside off, Finch bails out of his pull and it's called wide on height
that's a clean strike, Finch drives on the up through a full delivery and lofts it over mid-on
touch wider outside off, drags the length back, played to the covers
on off stump, short of a length at 86mph, defended to midwicket
a touch fuller this time, defended
gets onto off stump and punches a short-of-a-length delivery to mid-on
opens the face to a length delivery on off stump and finds Stokes at point
straighter this time, 87mph, defended firmly back to the bowler
gets beaten over the top edge as he tries to cut a shorter delivery...half-hearted shot
pushes it fuller again, at off stump, forced through the off side to deep square
clears mid-on again, holds his shape superbly as he punches through the line of a delivery which wasn't that full...had no intention of keeping it down
full at middle and off, 88mph, defended this time to mid-on
that's a club over the leg side, the bat face closed as he drove but he comfortably cleared the in-field
terrific stroke, fetches a short delivery from outside off and pulls it through square leg...had a lot of time to play that stroke
a little fuller, but Finch is still playing off the back foot as he punches back to Woakes
now he goes over mid-off, not quite out of the middle this time but plenty of weight behind the shot as he crunches it down the ground
on the back foot, defended to the bowler
touch of fortune this time as he forces off the back foot and gets an inside edge into his pads

nearly a tangle, but the catch is taken! Burns aiming to flick through the leg side, gets a leading edge towards mid-off. Roy came across from cover and almost collides with Morgan, but they just avoid a collision and the captain holds on
defended to the off side
a sweet way to get off the mark, drills a full ball through the off side...zinged off the bat
back of a length outside off, 88mph, defended to the covers
a shorter delivery, Smith is across his stumps and defends on the back foot
low full toss but it doesn't prove costly as Smith picks out mid-on
short of a length, angled into Finch, takes his thigh guard
fuller at off stump, 86mph, Finch staying back as he defends to cover
pushed straight down the pitch and mid-on can't get around in time
punched square to point
top shot, comes forward and pierces the gap through the off side with a compact cover drive
drags the length back and Smith defends to the covers
touch of extra bounce from a good length, or perhaps Finch was playing a little low...either way he pulled the bottom hand off the bat
short of a length at off stump, defended to the on side
punched into the off side
goes fuller, driven firmly towards mid-on
short and angled down the leg side...looked a sure wide, but Joel Wilson doesn't call it. Finch bemused
fuller, angled into the pads, flicked to midwicket
full outside off, 85mph, onto the front foot and defends
wristy from Smith was he flicks this from outside off through the leg side
a lovely piece of timing, blimey that was sweet, just punches a back-of-a-length delivery straight down the pitch. Splits mid-on and mid-off and just keeps on running away
flicked off the hip behind square
driven towards mid-on who is on the circle so it's an easy single
tight run! Back of a length, driven just to the left of Taylor at cover. Finch a little slow, but Taylor doesn't hit. Was probably safe.
shuffles across the crease, works towards the on side
flashed away behind point, width from Finn, but third man is able to get around
full outside off, 86mph, slotted straight to cover
defended from outside off to midwicket...as so often, you can see all three stumps behind him as Smith plays that
right across the crease again, clips a full ball which is probably around off stump down to long leg
cracks a pull a shot from well outside off, but Taylor flings himself to his left at midwicket and takes most of the pace off the shot
driven out to deep cover
full and very wide outside off, Finch chases it but doesn't connect...this time the wide is call
punched straight down the ground but mid-on gets around
full at off stump, 87mph, defended firmly back to the bowler
feeds off a straight delivery again, taken from around middle and off through the leg side
pings another straight drive with supreme timing, drilled in the air over Plunkett...one of the best places to hit a cricket ball
opens the face a touch this time as he drives and finds cover
drives a full ball from outside off and midwicket runs across to cut it off
gets away with this one, forcing off the back foot, his bat slices across the ball, gets an inside edge that scoots to the right of Bairstow
tucked off the pads to deep square leg
gets away with a ball on the pads, Finch picks out short fine leg
back on off stump, defended to the bowler in his follow through
on off stump, defended
full outside off, driven to deep cover
dragged down short outside off, but Finch can only find Rashid
works a straight delivery to the leg side
short again, this time it's driven off the back foot down the ground
not quite coming off the surface, which means Smith doesn't beat cover with his back-foot drive
fuller to end the over, flicked down to long-on
full outside off, Smith drives comes right out of the middle but straight to Morgan at cover
note the same power this time, places it wide of Morgan to the sweeper
full and straight, another piece of lovely timing down the ground but long-on is now in place
short or dropped? Taylor at midwicket. Flicked from Finch, bat face closed a touch, and it landed inches in front of Taylor as he dived forward
a cutter, 81mph, grips a touch and played into the leg side
well bowled, beats him outside off with a full delivery...not trying for top pace, the ball holds its line
beaten as he tries to cut a wide delivery
on leg stump, swept but picks out short fine leg
tossed up very full, clubbed down the ground
goes back and drives into the covers

what a catch! Finn at short midwicket. Unusual position for him, but he's used his reach to great effect. Smith down the pitch, aimed a flick through the leg side, Finn flings himself to his right - almost horizontal - sticks out his right hand and holds a blinder. Jonty Rhodes and Ben Stokes would have been proud.
uses his feet straightaway and drives down to long-off
full and wide, driven in the air over backward point, into big open space
full at off stump, defended to cover
past the edge, full outside off, just nips off the seam to beat Bailey's defensive shot
full and straight, driven back to the bowler
full outside leg stump, clipped to deep square
fantastic stroke, Finch moves on his merry way with a delightful drive wide of mid-off...onto the front foot
tossed up on leg stump, Bailey turns to leg but can't get it by midwicket
flighted, on the stumps, jams down on it and picks up one back past the bowler
this is a bit quicker, around off stump, pushed into the covers
gives this some air outside off, Finch presses forward and drives down the ground to long-off
punched slightly uppishly back past the bowler, another run to long-off
tossed up around off stump, Finch leans into a forward defensive

back of a length and turned through backward square... they come racing back for a second and the throw hits Finch as he runs his bat in. An English wag appeals for obstructing the field and there are grins all round
pitched up and pushed through the covers coming forwards
off-stump line, just a push down the ground from the ogre-strong Finch, long-on comes across to cut it off
outside off, drops back and runs one to third man
lovely stroke, power and placement from Finch, gets on to the front foot and bullets the ball wide of mid-off for four
pitched up on off stump, defended watchfully
flighted on the stumps, tries to reverse sweep but can't get it away
flighted on the stumps, skips down and drills a drive back past the stumps at the other end, Woakes saves it on the boundary
taps one more down the ground
tossed up and prodded defensively into the off side

googly from Rashid and Finch gets a bit lucky, looking to launch down the ground, a thick inside edge bounces out towards wide mid-on, between two men... Just a couple and that takes him to a solid fifty on his return
slow and loopy on the stumps, Finch plays it into the leg side
over the wicket, tossed up and Bailey uses the feet, whips a single down to long-on
flighted, Finch plants the foot and pushes another single to long-on
angled in with the arm and Bailey again leaves the crease to on drive down the ground
some turn for Moeen, past the inside edge and it loops up off the pad... Bairstow does brilliantly to chase and catch with one hand but Joel Wilson correctly adjudges that there was no glove involved
length ball, spinning in and deflected down the leg side
flighted, outside off, blocked coming forwards
on the stumps, worked across the line and they pick up one via a misfield at midwicket
tossed up, comes forward and pushes down the ground, maybe a leading edge
floated up on leg stump, turned to midwicket

Finch tries to tee off... and hits it straight up and down into the safe hands of Woakes running in from long-on! Rashid has a second, he's been a struggle to score off and Finch was trying to break the shackles, a moment of Hulk-like violence but he is soon slinking off looking more like Bruce Banner
tossed up, leaves the crease and squirts a leading edge to short straight mid0off
even slower, there's some turn again and an outside edge runs into a gap at cover to keep Bailey on strike
tossed up outside off and spinning in as Bailey advances and is hit on the pad
Bailey leaves his crease early again, Moeen drags it down and the ball loops off the pads again as Bailey pulls out of the shot
skips down once more, again it's too short for him to get to
flighted, reverses the hands this time, hit on the wrists
flighted around off stump and spinning in, can't get this one away to the leg side
tossed up, spinning from off outside leg stump, Buttler collects and it's not called wide - maiden for Moeen
floated up, slightly leg side, Maxwell pushes at it and the ball runs fine off the pad
a beauty, tossed up legbreak and spinning past the outside edge as Bailey presses forwards
tossed up outside off, pushed back down the track
comes forward and pushes into the covers
driven, in the air but just past the dive of short mid-off! Wasn't quite to the pitch but got away with the stroke
tossed up outside off, Maxwell has a big yahoo across the line and misses completely
slightly short and Bailey swats it forcefully around the corner... straight to square leg, however
comes forward and works the ball to midwicket
tossed up, drifting in, Bailey whips the ball with the spin through mid-on
floated up outside off, Maxwell turns the ball softly into the leg side
full, flighted outside off, Maxwell reverses the bat and sweeps, briefly in the air but short of the man on the edge of the ring
slow, on the stumps, Maxwell can only dink it into the leg side
ugly long hop down the leg side from Rashid... but Bailey can only swipe it straight to short fine leg! Missed out there, even England's bad balls are becoming dots
tossed up, comes forward and drives wide of the catcher, Stokes diving after it, and down to long-off
Maxwell leans back and lashes a couple over the covers, it's reeled in out towards the boundary
flighted, on the stumps, Maxwell hits against the spin and gets it into a gap wide of long-on, who slides but can't prevent four - welcome boundary for Australia
chipped over the infield this time, a flamingo flick from Maxwell, wide of long-on again for a couple
on the stumps and whipped through midwicket for a single to keep the strike
superbly done by Maxwell, reverse-sweeping against the spin and it's in the air but in front of point and bounces away to the unprotected boundary
tossed up and Maxwell plays that vengeful reverse-slap over cover again! This was struck even more firmly, high and into the gap for four more

tries a reverse dab this time, a top edge loops up and Bairstow takes a simple catch! Umpire Wilson slowly raises his finger and although Maxwell looks disgusted it is probably with the shot rather than the decision. It was more of a poke where the previous two attempts went fully through with the shot and the ball spooned off the toe, hit the arm and Bairstow didn't have far to go to complete the catch
comes forward and is off the mark first ball with a clip down the ground
on the stumps and flicked through the leg side, slightly aerial but lands safely
goes back and defends to the leg side
shouts of "catch it!" as Bailey skews a drive over the covers, it's all height and no trousers... but lands safely between about three fielders
spinning in, the wrong 'un, worked to midwicket
leans out to drive and gets a thick edge through cover point for four
drops a little short and Marsh stays back, clips the ball firmly through backward square, no one out there and it's four
flighted, punched down the ground and mid-off cuts it off, scrambling after it to prevent a run

pushed through quicker and he's trapped on the crease, up goes the finger! Marsh has a chat with George Bailey and asks for a review and, although he seemed to be pretty adjacent, Hawk-Eye shows that is was juuuuuuuuuuusssst missing off stump, straightening slightly too much - so Rob Bailey's decision is overturned and Marsh continues
floated up on the stumps, goes down on one knee and paddles a couple through fine leg
turned through the leg side, they think about two but settle for a single
flat on the stumps, Marsh stands up and punches one to long-on
pushed through a bit quicker outside off, Bailey jumps out and defends

full toss from Moeen, clubbed to leg... but straight to the fielder at deep midwicket! Bailey can't believe it but England are delighted, he came down the pitch and heaved a rank delivery down the throat of Stokes as he came in off the rope
round the wicket, angled in and defended pressing forwards
floated up on the stumps, Marsh shuffles across and blocks
lovely delivery, flighted outside off and spinning away as Marsh feels for it
struck on the pads playing back this time, possibly outside the line again
on the stumps, worked into the leg side
tossed up outside off, Marsh drives a little uppishly but the ball bounces short of cover
gives it some air, outside off, Marsh watchfully blocks coming forwards - another maiden for England
tossed up and defended pressing forwards on off stump
on the stumps and blocked
tight stuff from Moeen, lines it up in defence
flat offbreak, comes across and pushes back down the ground
angled in, Wade makes a bit of room for himself and drives back past the bowler to long-off
flighted, outside off, Marsh prods at it and edges wide of the keeper, no slip and he'll get one
floated up outside off, steps forward and punches through the covers
tossed up, slightly leg side and the ball spins past the bat, runs away for a couple
floated up across the left-hander from over the wicket, Wade goes down on one knee and ramps one fine
flighted on the stumps, pushed back past the bowler to long-on
touch short, Wade drops back and stabs one more through the covers
another pearler from Rashid, gives it a rip, pitches on leg and breaks past Marsh's outside edge, into the keeper's gloves
tossed up on middle and leg, Marsh covers the line this time and blocks - that's the end of an excellent spell from Rashid
flat on off, tapped into the covers defensively
touch short, Wade goes back on off stump, back-foot punch through cover point
on the stumps, flicked to leg slightly aerially, falls short of midwicket
on the stumps, dabbed into the covers
goes back in the crease and flicks the ball with the turn through backward square for one
goes back, play-and-a-miss and Wade nearly perishes, the ball blowing a kiss at the off bail as it straightens
good length on off stump, squared up slightly and steered towards point
shuffles back and across and again blocks a length ball into the off side
fullish, Marsh gets forward and punches a drive through the covers
length outside off stump, Wade runs the ball towards backward point
fuller, gets forward, driven crisply through the covers to the fielder in the deep

slightly back of a length, Marsh shovels it off his hips.... straight to midwicket! Another one goes, Marsh having to make the disconsolate trudge back to the changing rooms. Australia in the doo-doo now
driven off the back foot to deep cover
digs out his first ball in ODI cricket back to the bowler
gets forward, bat and pad together, defends
drives into the covers
can't find a gap
very full, drilled down to long-off
flashes and misses outside off, perhaps didn't quite get up as Agar thought
comes round the wicket, jabs out a yorker to the off side
into the off side
angled down the leg side, shapes to flick it away, he misses but gets the wide
works a straight delivery through midwicket
comes forward and gets this one past the cover ring
low full toss, played from outside leg stump into the covers
driven down to long off
dabbed into the covers
dug out down the ground
down to long off
driven back to the bowler
drops this shorter outside off but Wade can only find cover
back of a length at off stump, pushed towards mid-off
tight with a direct hit, turned into midwicket where Morgan was quickly onto it but the throw is wide...Wade was gone
defended to the covers
back of a length, cramps him for room, pushed to the off side
fuller and wider outside off, driven to deep cover

amazing! Roy holds what turns into a screamer. Agar launched this miles into the night sky and into the lights. Roy steadies himself at long on, but slightly misjudges it and the ball spills out as he falls backwards but, astonishingly, he is able to hold the rebound before the ball falls to the ground. A touch of fortune, yes, but some mind-boggling reflexes and awareness
in the air again! Driven just wide of cover, Morgan can't get across
swept to deep square leg
a heave and a miss to the leg side...nearly bowled
and again, more fresh air as Moeen tosses it up
what lovely bowling! Pitches on off stump, spins, and takes Starc's outside edge as he drives...neat catch from Bairstow
pushed down the ground from outside off
works a length delivery into the leg side, they come back for a second and Hales throws to the wrong end...Cummins was struggling
swing and a miss to the leg side
sweet connection on this one as he clubs over the leg side to deep midwicket
another catch for Roy...much more regulation. Cummins lofts a length delivery right down his throat at long-on
he's clobbered that, a back-of-a-length ball, through the covers
heaved down the ground
back of a length outside off, beats him as he tries to go through the off side
very wide outside off
swung to cover
pulled from outside off down to long on
crunched down the ground, one bounce to long-off
a slower, short ball outside off, dies under Pattinson's bottom edge
tries to pull again, comes off the splice of the bat into the off side but short of cover
full outside off, a big swoosh from Wade
gets too leg side, pulled backward of square
comes down the pitch, it's a big full toss outside off which is sliced down to third man
yorker outside off, jabbed to the leg side
swung down to long-on
clubbed from outside off into midwicket
a length delivery outside off, smacked out to deep cover

an appeal for lbw, pitched outside leg, but there should have been run out. Throw went to the wrong end again. Just a little bit of chaos. And now they review the lbw. And, yes, it pitched miles outside leg.
full and straight, heaved back over Stokes' head to long-on
a shorter ball, at the body, takes him in the chest
slogged into the leg side, Stokes gets across
yorker at leg stump, Pattinson manages to keep it out
that's a good shot, drives a back-of-a-length delivery over extra cover and wide of long-off
down the pitch and then pulls over midwicket
gives himself a touch of room and cuts to deep cover
that made a terrific noise of the bat, pulled from outside off high over midwicket but drops just short of being six...longest boundary
and now he goes wide of long-off, another lovely clean strike
and that's all over! Down the pitch, swings to leg against a length delivery, misses and gets cleaned up
